titles.en: Chapter 2 – The Miscellaneous regarding the animals
Chapter 2 – The Miscellaneous regarding the animals

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لِلدَّابَّةِ عَلَى صَاحِبِهَا سِتَّةُ حُقُوقٍ لَا يُحَمِّلُهَا فَوْقَ طَاقَتِهَا وَ لَا يَتَّخِذُ ظَهْرَهَا مَجَالِسَ يَتَحَدَّثُ عَلَيْهَا وَ يَبْدَأُ بِعَلْفِهَا إِذَا نَزَلَ وَ لَا يَسِمُهَا وَ لَا يَضْرِبُهَا فِي وَجْهِهَا فَإِنَّهَا تُسَبِّحُ وَ يَعْرِضُ عَلَيْهَا الْمَاءَ إِذَا مَرَّ بِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For the animal, upon its owner, are six rights – he would not burden it above its strength, nor would he take its back as a seat for having discussions upon it, and he would begin by feeding it when he descends, and he would not brand it, and he would not harm it in its face for it Glorifies (Allah<sup>azwj</sup>), and he would present the water to it whenever he passes by it’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْمَغْرَاءِ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ خَالِدٍ قَالَ فِيمَا أَظُنُّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ رُئِيَ أَبُو ذَرٍّ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ يَسْقِي حِمَاراً بِالرَّبَذَةِ فَقَالَ لَهُ بَعْضُ النَّاسِ أَ مَا لَكَ يَا أَبَا ذَرٍّ مَنْ يَكْفِيكَ سَقْيَ الْحِمَارِ فَقَالَ سَمِعْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) يَقُولُ مَا مِنْ دَابَّةٍ إِلَّا وَ هِيَ تَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ كُلَّ صَبَاحٍ اللَّهُمَّ ارْزُقْنِي مَلِيكاً صَالِحاً يُشْبِعُنِي مِنَ الْعَلَفِ وَ يُرْوِينِي مِنَ الْمَاءِ وَ لَا يُكَلِّفُنِي فَوْقَ طَاقَتِي فَأَنَا أُحِبُّ أَنْ أَسْقِيَهُ بِنَفْسِي .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Abu Al Magra, from Suleyman Bin Khalid who said regarding what I think is, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Abu Zarr<sup>ra</sup> was seen watering a donkey at Al-Rabza, so one of the people said to him<sup>ra</sup>, ‘Is there not for you<sup>as</sup>, O Abu Zarr<sup>ra</sup>, one who would water the donkey for you<sup>as</sup>?’ So he<sup>as</sup> said: ‘I<sup>ra</sup> heard Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> saying: ‘There is none from the animals except that it asks Allah<sup>azwj</sup> every morning, ‘O Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Grant me a righteous owner who would satiate me from the feed, and would quench me from the water, and would not encumber me above my strength’. Therefore I<sup>ra</sup> love to water it myself<sup>ra</sup>’.

verses.text:
الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ طَرْخَانَ النَّخَّاسِ قَالَ مَرَرْتُ بِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ قَدْ نَزَلَ الْحِيرَةَ فَقَالَ لِي مَا عِلَاجُكَ قُلْتُ نَخَّاسٌ فَقَالَ أَصِبْ لِي بَغْلَةً فَضْحَاءَ قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ وَ مَا الْفَضْحَاءُ قَالَ دَهْمَاءُ بَيْضَاءُ الْبَطْنِ بَيْضَاءُ الْأَفْحَاجِ بَيْضَاءُ الْجَحْفَلَةِ قَالَ فَقُلْتُ وَ اللَّهِ مَا رَأَيْتُ مِثْلَ هَذِهِ الصِّفَةِ 
فَرَجَعْتُ مِنْ عِنْدِهِ فَسَاعَةً دَخَلْتُ الْخَنْدَقَ إِذَا أَنَا غُلَامٌ قَدْ أَشْفَى عَلَى بَغْلَةٍ عَلَى هَذَا الصِّفَةِ فَسَأَلْتُ الْغُلَامَ لِمَنْ هَذِهِ الْبَغْلَةُ فَقَالَ لِمَوْلَايَ قُلْتُ يَبِيعُهَا قَالَ لَا أَدْرِي فَتَبِعْتُهُ حَتَّى أَتَيْتُ مَوْلَاهُ فَاشْتَرَيْتُهَا مِنْهُ وَ أَتَيْتُهُ بِهَا فَقَالَ هَذِهِ الصِّفَةُ الَّتِي أَرَدْتُهَا قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ ادْعُ اللَّهَ لِي فَقَالَ أَكْثَرَ اللَّهُ مَالَكَ وَ وَلَدَكَ قَالَ فَصِرْتُ أَكْثَرَ أَهْلِ الْكُوفَةِ مَالًا وَ وَلَداً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Al Washa, from Tarkhan Al Nakhas who said, ‘I passed by Abu Abdullahasws and heasws had lodged at Al-Hira, so heasws said to me: ‘What is your occupation?’ I said, ‘Animal trader’. So heasws said: ‘Find a Fazaah mule for me’. I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for youasws! And what is Al-Fazaah?’ Heasws said: ‘Plain, of white belly, white thighs, white mouth’. I said, ‘By Allahazwj! I have not seen the likes of this description’. So I returned from hisasws presence, so after a while I entered the ditch, and there was a slave who had sat upon a mule of this description. So I asked the slave, ‘For whom is this mule?’ So he said, ‘For my master’. I said, ‘Would he sell it’. He said, ‘I do not know’. So I followed him until I came up to his master. So I bought it from him, and I came over with it to himasws(the Imamasws). So heasws said: ‘This is the description which Iasws wanted’. I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for youasws! Supplicate to Allahazwj for me’. So heasws said: ‘May Allahazwj Amplify your wealth and your children’. He (the narrator) said, ‘So I became to be of the most abundant of the people of Al-Kufa in wealth and children’.

verses.text:
عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ جَدِّهِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لَا تَضْرِبُوا الدَّوَابَّ عَلَى وُجُوهِهَا فَإِنَّهَا تُسَبِّحُ بِحَمْدِ اللَّهِ .
قَالَ وَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ لَا تَسِمُوهَا فِي وُجُوهِهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Qasim Bin Yahya, from his grandfather Al Hassan Bin Rashid, from Muhammad Bin Muslim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Do not strike the animals upon their faces, for they Glorify with the Praise of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’. 
He<sup>asws</sup> (the Imam<sup>asws</sup>) said in another Hadeeth: ‘Do not brand them (curse them and hit) in their faces’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ يَسَارٍ عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ الدِّهْقَانِ عَنْ دُرُسْتَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِذَا عَثَرَتِ الدَّابَّةُ تَحْتَ الرَّجُلِ فَقَالَ لَهَا تَعَسْتِ تَقُولُ تَعَسَ أَعْصَانَا لِلرَّبِّ.

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ja’far Bin Muhammad Bin Yasaar, from Ubeydullah Al Dahqan, from Dorost, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘When the animal stumbles beneath the man, so he (the man) says to it, ‘May you be ruined’. It (the animal) says, ‘May the one (who is) disobedient to the Lord<sup>azwj</sup> be ruined’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ الصَّادِقَ ( عليه السلام ) مَتَى أَضْرِبُ دَابَّتِي تَحْتِي فَقَالَ إِذَا لَمْ تَمْشِ تَحْتَكَ كَمَشْيَتِهَا إِلَى مِذْوَدِهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ali Bin Ibrahim Al Ja’fary, raising it, said, 
‘I asked Al-Sadiq<sup>asws</sup>, ‘When can I strike my animal under me?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘When it does not walk under you like it walks to its feeding place’.

verses.text: وَ رُوِيَ عَنِ النَّبِيِّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَنَّهُ قَالَ اضْرِبُوهَا عَلَى النِّفَارِ وَ لَا تَضْرِبُوهَا عَلَى الْعِثَارِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
And it is reported, 
(It has been narrated) from the Prophet<sup>saww</sup> having said: ‘Strike it (animal) upon the fleeing, and do not strike it upon the stumbling’.

verses.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْخَشَّابِ عَنِ ابْنِ بَقَّاحٍ عَنْ مُعَاذٍ الْجَوْهَرِيِّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ جُمَيْعٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لَا تَتَوَرَّكُوا عَلَى الدَّوَابِّ وَ لَا تَتَّخِذُوا ظُهُورَهَا مَجَالِسَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Al Khashab, from Ibn Baqah, from Moaz Al Jowhary, from Amro Bin Jumie, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Do not sit upon the animal with both feet hanging on one side, and do not take its back for a meeting place (to hold discussions while sitting upon it)’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ كَانَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَا بَهِمَتِ الْبَهَائِمُ فَلَمْ تُبْهَمْ عَنْ أَرْبَعَةٍ مَعْرِفَتِهَا بِالرَّبِّ وَ مَعْرِفَتِهَا بِالْمَوْتِ وَ مَعْرِفَتِهَا بِالْأُنْثَى مِنَ الذَّكَرِ وَ مَعْرِفَتِهَا بِالْمَرْعَى عَنِ الْخِصْبِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ibn Raib, from Abu Hamza who said, 
‘Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘Whatever the dullness of the animals may be, but it is not dull from four (matters) – its recognition of the Lord<sup>azwj</sup>, and its recognition with the death, and its recognition with the female and the male, and its recognition with the pasture from the cultivated’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لِكُلِّ شَيْ‏ءٍ حُرْمَةٌ وَ حُرْمَةُ الْبَهَائِمِ فِي وُجُوهِهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For everything is a sanctity, and a sanctity of the animals is in their faces’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنِ الْحَجَّالِ وَ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَهْمَا أُبْهِمَ عَلَى الْبَهَائِمِ مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ فَلَا يُبْهَمُ عَلَيْهَا أَرْبَعَةُ خِصَالٍ مَعْرِفَةُ أَنَّ لَهَا خَالِقاً وَ مَعْرِفَةُ طَلَبِ الرِّزْقِ وَ مَعْرِفَةُ الذَّكَرِ مِنَ الْأُنْثَى وَ مَخَافَةُ الْمَوْتِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Al Hajjal and Ibn Fazzal, from Yaqoub Bin Salim, from a man, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whatever dullness of the animals may be from something, but it would not be dull upon four qualities – Recognising that there is a Creator for it, and recognising seeking of the sustenance, and recognising the male from the female, and fear of the death’.

verses.text: سَهْلُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ شَمُّونٍ عَنِ الْأَصَمِّ عَنْ مِسْمَعِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) اضْرِبُوهَا عَلَى النِّفَارِ وَ لَا تَضْرِبُوهَا عَلَى الْعِثَارِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan Bin Shamoun, from Al Asam, from Misma’a Bin Abdul Malik, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Strike it upon the fleeing but do not strike it upon the stumbling’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ جَدِّهِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ عَلَى كُلِّ مَنْخِرٍ مِنَ الدَّوَابِّ شَيْطَانٌ فَإِذَا أَرَادَ أَحَدُكُمْ أَنْ يُلْجِمَهَا فَلْيُسَمِّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Qasim Bin Yahya, from his grandfather Al Hassan Bin Rashid, from Yaqoub Bin Ja’far who said, 
‘I heard Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Upon each nostril of the animal is a Satan<sup>la</sup>. So whenever one of you to bridle it, so he should Name Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic’.

verses.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا ( عليهما السلام ) قَالَ أَيُّمَا دَابَّةٍ اسْتَصْعَبَتْ عَلَى صَاحِبِهَا مِنْ لِجَامٍ وَ نِفَارٍ فَلْيَقْرَأْ فِي أُذُنِهَا أَوْ عَلَيْهَا أَ فَغَيْرَ دِينِ اللَّهِ يَبْغُونَ وَ لَهُ أَسْلَمَ مَنْ فِي السَّماواتِ وَ الْأَرْضِ طَوْعاً وَ كَرْهاً وَ إِلَيْهِ يُرْجَعُونَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ibn Raib, from Abu Ubeyda, (It has been narrated) from one of the two (5th or 6th Imamasws) having said: ‘Whichever animal disobeys its owner from bridling and flees, so let him recite in its ears, or upon it - [3:83] Is it other than Allah's Religion that they seek (to follow), and to Him submits whoever is in the skies and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him shall they be returning’.

verses.text:
عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( صلوات الله عليه ) إِنَّ مِنَ الْحَقِّ أَنْ يَقُولَ الرَّاكِبُ لِلْمَاشِي الطَّرِيقَ .
وَ فِي نُسْخَةٍ أُخْرَى إِنَّ مِنَ الْجَوْرِ أَنْ يَقُولَ الرَّاكِبُ لِلْمَاشِي الطَّرِيقَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim who said, 
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is from the right that the rider says to the walker, ‘The road’ (Make way)’. 
And in another copy – ‘(He<sup>asws</sup> said): ‘It is from the inequity that the rider should be saying to the walker, ‘The road’ (Make way)’.

verses.text: وَ بِإِسْنَادِهِ قَالَ خَرَجَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ رَاكِبٌ فَمَشَوْا مَعَهُ فَقَالَ أَ لَكُمْ حَاجَةٌ قَالُوا لَا وَ لَكِنَّا نُحِبُّ أَنْ نَمْشِيَ مَعَكَ فَقَالَ لَهُمُ انْصَرِفُوا فَإِنَّ مَشْيَ الْمَاشِي مَعَ الرَّاكِبِ مَفْسَدَةٌ لِلرَّاكِبِ وَ مَذَلَّةٌ لِلْمَاشِي .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
And by his chain, said, 
‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> went out and he<sup>asws</sup> was riding, so they (people) walked along with him<sup>asws</sup>. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Is there any need for you (to be fulfilled)?’ They said, ‘No, but we love it that we should be walking along with you<sup>asws</sup>’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Disperse, for the walking of the walker with the rider is a spoiler for the rider, and a humiliation for the walker’.

verses.text:
عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ الدِّهْقَانِ عَنْ دُرُسْتَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْحَمِيدِ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِذَا رَكِبَ الرَّجُلُ الدَّابَّةَ فَسَمَّى رَدِفَهُ مَلَكٌ يَحْفَظُهُ حَتَّى يَنْزِلَ وَ إِذَا رَكِبَ وَ لَمْ يُسَمِّ رَدِفَهُ شَيْطَانٌ فَيَقُولُ لَهُ تَغَنَّ فَإِنْ قَالَ لَهُ لَا أُحْسِنُ قَالَ لَهُ تَمَنَّ فَلَا يَزَالُ يَتَمَنَّى حَتَّى يَنْزِلَ 
وَ قَالَ مَنْ قَالَ إِذَا رَكِبَ الدَّابَّةَ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي هَدانا لِهذا الْآيَةَ وَ سُبْحانَ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَنا هذا وَ ما كُنَّا لَهُ مُقْرِنِينَ حُفِظَتْ لَهُ نَفْسُهُ وَ دَابَّتُهُ حَتَّى يَنْزِلَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Al Dahqan, from Dorost, from Ibrahim Bin Abdul Hameed, (It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassanasws having said: ‘Rasool-Allahsaww said: ‘When the man rides the animal, so he Names (Bismillah) and Angel rides behind him, protecting him until he descends; and when he rides and does not Name (Bismillah), a Satanla rides behind him, so hela is saying to him, ‘Sing!’ So if he says to himla, ‘I am not good at it’, hela says to him, ‘Wish for it’. So he does not cease wishing until he descends’. And heasws said: ‘The one who says whenever he rides the animal, ‘In the Name of Allahazwj, there is no Might or Strength except with Allahazwj, [7:43] All Praise is due to Allah Who Guided us to this, and we would not have found the Way had it not been that Allah had Guided us, [43:13] Glory be to Him Who Made this subservient to us and we were not able to do it’, Allahazwj would Protect for him his self, and his animal until he descends’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ أَوْ غَيْرُهُ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ خَرَجَ عَبْدُ الصَّمَدِ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ وَ مَعَهُ جَمَاعَةٌ فَبَصُرَ بِأَبِي الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) مُقْبِلًا رَاكِباً بَغْلًا فَقَالَ لِمَنْ مَعَهُ مَكَانَكُمْ حَتَّى أُضْحِكَكُمْ مِنْ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ فَلَمَّا دَنَا مِنْهُ قَالَ لَهُ مَا هَذِهِ الدَّابَّةُ الَّتِي لَا تُدْرِكُ عَلَيْهَا الثَّأْرَ وَ لَا تَصْلُحُ عِنْدَ النِّزَالِ فَقَالَ لَهُ أَبُو الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) تَطَأْطَأَتْ عَنْ سُمُوِّ الْخَيْلِ وَ تَجَاوَزَتْ قُمُوءَ الْعَيْرِ وَ خَيْرُ الْأُمُورِ أَوْسَطُهَا فَأُفْحِمَ عَبْدُ الصَّمَدِ فَمَا أَحَارَ جَوَاباً .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, or someone else, raising it, said, 
‘Abdul Samam Bin Ali went out and with him was a group of people, so he saw Abu Al Hassan Musa Bin Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> riding a mule towards him. So he said to the ones who were with him, ‘Stay in your places until I make you laugh from Musa<sup>asws</sup> Bin Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>’. So when he approached him<sup>asws</sup>, said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What is this animal upon which neither can the vengeance be realised nor is it correct for the battleground’. So Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> said to him: ‘I<sup>asws</sup> have come down from the elevation of the cavalry horse and have exceeded the lowliness of the wild ass, and the best of the affairs is in its middle’. So Abdul Samad was speechless and could not responded with an answer’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ عِدَّةٍ مِنْ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ عَمِّهِ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ سَالِمٍ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( صلوات الله عليه ) قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لَا يَرْتَدِفْ ثَلَاثَةٌ عَلَى دَابَّةٍ فَإِنَّ أَحَدَهُمْ مَلْعُونٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from a number of our companions, from Ali Bin Asbaat, from his uncle Yaqoub Bin Salim, raising it, said, 
‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Three must not ride upon one animal, for one of them would be an Accursed’.
